sentence.text: Dear Guitarist I am writing to compliment you on an almost unbeatable magazine .
I had also just complimented her on her dress .
Christina forced herself to compliment Rachael Mottely on her heavily pleated canary-yellow dress .
I complimented him on his artistic prowess as a surgeon ; he smiled .
Several people complimented her on the beauty of the surroundings , because it was her picnic and so for a while Wales was her dining-room .
Being English , she thought that a sure way of bestowing pleasure on strangers was to compliment them on their dogs .
After a time David relaxed and joined in , complimenting Felicity , chaffing her husband and turning often to Julia to remind-her of earlier conversations they had had or to ask her opinion .
Her quick response made him feel more quick , as if in some flattering way she was complimenting him .
Loads of people have complimented me , including one very important person . "
I 'd like to compliment ZZAP ! on a great mag which I 'm sure will go on for years to come ( ho ho ho ! -- Ed . )
It 's men who are complimented for being ` cocky " , who thrive on that kind of vanity and self-assurance .
At the orphanage I was complimented on me English composition , but I 've always been a bit shy about speakin' up for meself . "
Well , I do 'appen to 'ave good legs , and I 've been complimented on me knees too . "
Erm , I would like to particularly compliment the Fire Service on the magnificent job they were doing there , in , in the most appalling conditions .
The Frenchman treated me like a son ; his wife was a little more distant and cool so I complimented her and brought her small gifts , wooing her as if she was the maid .
All our sketches are much approved of and highly complimented by our friends .
